@graph.headline: What Is Few-Shot Prompting: Making AI Actually Do What You Want
@graph.description: Few-shot prompting is a technique that guides large language models by providing several examples directly within the prompt to demonstrate specific tasks and desired output formats.

@graph.name: What Is Few-Shot Prompting: Making AI Actually Do What You Want

hasDefinedTerm.name: Few-Shot Prompting
hasDefinedTerm.description: A technique that guides large language models by providing several examples, or 'shots,' directly within the prompt to demonstrate a specific task and desired output format.

hasDefinedTerm.name: In-Context Learning
hasDefinedTerm.description: The ability of language models to learn and perform tasks based on examples provided within the input prompt, without changing the model's internal parameters.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Large Language Models
hasDefinedTerm.description: Massive neural networks trained on vast amounts of text data that can understand and generate human-like text across various tasks.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Prompt Engineering
hasDefinedTerm.description: The practice of designing and optimizing input prompts to effectively communicate with and guide AI language models to produce desired outputs.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Chain-of-Thought Prompting
hasDefinedTerm.description: A prompting technique that includes step-by-step reasoning in examples to teach models how to approach complex logic and reasoning tasks.

hasDefinedTerm.name: GPT-3
hasDefinedTerm.description: A large language model developed by OpenAI that demonstrated the effectiveness of few-shot prompting and in-context learning capabilities.

@graph.name: How to Create Effective Few-Shot Prompts
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide to creating high-quality few-shot prompts for AI language models

supply.name: Access to a large language model (GPT-3, GPT-4, etc.)
Clear understanding of the desired task

step.name: Define the Task
step.text: Write a clear, concise task description that explains what you want the model to do (e.g., 'Classify these movie reviews as positive, neutral, or negative.')

step.name: Create High-Quality Examples
step.text: Develop 2-5 input-output pairs that demonstrate the task perfectly, covering different types of expected responses

step.name: Ensure Consistent Formatting
step.text: Use clear labels (Input:, Output:) and maintain the same structure for every example, including spacing and punctuation

step.name: Add Your Query
step.text: Present your new input in the exact same format as your examples, followed by the appropriate label to cue the model

step.name: Test and Iterate
step.text: Experiment with different examples, formats, and ordering to find the optimal prompt structure for your specific task

@graph.name: Advantages of Few-Shot Prompting
@graph.description: Key benefits of using few-shot prompting techniques

itemListElement.name: Less Data Needed
itemListElement.description: Stop worrying about massive datasets for every little thing

itemListElement.name: Saves Money
itemListElement.description: Avoids the huge computational costs of model fine-tuning

itemListElement.name: Fast & Flexible
itemListElement.description: Prototype and launch new AI solutions in a flash

itemListElement.name: Total User Control
itemListElement.description: Directly steer the model's output with your examples

itemListElement.name: Incredibly Versatile
itemListElement.description: A single model can be taught to do countless different tasks

itemListElement.name: Better Performance
itemListElement.description: Delivers far better results than just asking a question with no examples (zero-shot)

itemListElement.name: Accessible to All
itemListElement.description: Lowers the barrier for using advanced AI effectively

@graph.name: Limitations of Few-Shot Prompting
@graph.description: Key challenges and limitations when using few-shot prompting

itemListElement.name: Context Window Limits
itemListElement.description: You can only provide so many examples due to input length constraints

itemListElement.name: Prompt Sensitivity
itemListElement.description: Performance is highly dependent on the exact formatting and wording

itemListElement.name: Risk of Bias
itemListElement.description: Your examples can accidentally teach the model bad habits or biases

itemListElement.name: Inconsistent Results
itemListElement.description: Can sometimes be less consistent than fine-tuned models
